text: North Upper Saxon () is a dialect spoken in Eastern Germany. It divides up to Upper Saxon German, South Markish dialects, Thuringian, and Brandenburgisch.Ludwig Erich Schmitt (editor): Germanische Dialektologie. Franz Steiner, Wiesbaden 1968, p. 143 It is spoken around Leipzig. ==References== Category:German dialects Category:Languages of Germany Category:Saxony Category:Saxony-Anhalt Category:Brandenburg
title: North Upper Saxon
